{"step_by_step_thinking": "The hyoglossus muscle is a muscle in the neck that depresses the tongue. It is important to know what structures lie deep to it. The hypoglossal nerve, lingual artery, and geniohyoid muscle all lie deep to the hyoglossus muscle. However, the stylohyoid muscle does not. It is located superior and lateral to the hyoglossus muscle.", "answer_choice": "C. Stylohyoid muscle"}
